title: Ticket #77: Changes to CSS
description:
Proposals to improve the look of GitTrac. These would modify the cvstrac.css or similar attached to http://condor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu/index.cgi/setup_style

Tone down borders in reports

The borders in reports are unnecessarily guady. This tones them down so they're less noisy, while keeping them usable for reading long reports. 

/* Tone down borders in the reports */
table.report {
        border-collapse: collapse;
}
table.report td, table.report th {
        border: 1px solid #888;
}

Make header stretch to edges

The headers should stretch to the edges, like at http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/new/ . 

/* Stretch title section to top, left, and right edges */
/* This replaces the "body" declaration near the top */
body {background-color: white; padding: 0; margin: 0; border: 0;}
/* This can be added anywhere, or merged with the existing
 * #content declaration */
#content { margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; }

Use CSS for code/endcode blocks

For consistency and simplification. 

/* 1. Replace code/endcode use of a table with [pre class="code"]
   2. Set up the CSS. */
/* This emulates the existing formatting: */
pre.code {
    width: 95%;
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
}
/* This is a different option: */
pre.code {
        margin-left: 2em;
}
/* Perhaps dress it up */
pre.code {
        background-color: #AAA;
        border: 1px solid #666;
}
